turns.model_response:
The Euclidean distance between the points (1, 2) and (3, 4) can be calculated using the distance formula:

\[ \text{Distance} = \sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2} \]

Substituting the given coordinates:

\[
\begin{align*}
\text{Distance} &= \sqrt{(3 - 1)^2 + (4 - 2)^2} \\
&= \sqrt{(2)^2 + (2)^2} \\
&= \sqrt{4 + 4} \\
&= \sqrt{8} \\
&= 2\sqrt{2}
\end{align*}
\]

**Answer:** The Euclidean distance between the points (1, 2) and (3, 4) is \(2\sqrt{2}\).
